Text: Valuation Model ProjectsThe projects in the lastest copy of the evaluation model are outlined in the attached file

Expansion Projects Cc The attached files are based on old estimates for the various expansions The project that go inservice for I assumed no impact to fuel based on usage versus retainage The project are as follow TransPecos inservice Red Rock Station inservice Qtr San Juan Expansion inservice Qtr Mainline Expansion inservice Qtr California Pipeline Bakerfield inservice Qtr Mainline Expansion inservice Qtr

RE tw subscription rolloff templateFacilty Planning personnel are out of office today but will return in the morning I have ask for their estimate no later than Monday morning They may be able to give me something tommorrow I will complete the project model when I get a description of facilities and cost estimates James Original Message From Howard Kevin A Sent Thursday February AM To Hayslett Rod Thames Davis Geaccone Tracy Ratner Michael Donoho Lindy Centilli James Subject RE tw subscription rolloff template James Can you roll each of the expansions that we discussed into Rods project model Michael Ratner will then link those into the TW financial model Kevin Original Message From Hayslett Rod Sent Thursday February AM To Howard Kevin A Thames Davis Geaccone Tracy Ratner Michael Donoho Lindy Centilli James Subject RE tw subscription rolloff template Project model Original Message From Howard Kevin A Sent Thursday February AM To Thames Davis Geaccone Tracy Ratner Michael Donoho Lindy Centilli James Cc Hayslett Rod Subject RE tw subscription rolloff template Attached is the actual contract roll off info by segment prepared by Shelley Corman for our bank due diligence We need to use this and assume we resubscribe the roll off capacity at an average rate Lindy we will need your assistance in developing this avg rate by segment For the expansions we discussed Rod will circulate an expansion model that we can layer into the financial model Tracy call me when you get in and we can discuss Kevin Original Message From Thames Davis Sent Wednesday February PM To Howard Kevin A Geaccone Tracy Ratner Michael Donoho Lindy Centilli James Subject tw subscription rolloff template I have attached a template to use to summarize the capacity rolloff issue discussed today I just filled in a bunch of numbers as an example if they dont make any sense you can guess why Lindy if you could use this to fill in the required data then either Michael or I will incorporate it into the TW model Thanks Davis

RE Sun Devil Cc The GRI is a voluntary surcharge that the Shipper indicates they want to pay We just collect it and pass it on to the Gas Research institute The ACA is an Annual Charge Adjustment to recover cost charged to us by FERC We typically do not waive or discount this charge The other surcharges are due to past settlements and are not applicable to new expansion projects These are defined in the Tariff in sections and of the General Terms and Conditions Lindy Did I state this correctly Please let Eric and me know if I miss stated anything Original Message From Gadd Eric Sent Tuesday February PM To Centilli James Subject Sun Devil James On Sun Devil are we required to collect GRI ACA or any other surcharges If so how are they applied If not why

RE LaPlata DRA Application Cost EstimateThe project can not be justified if you have the capital cost of the pigging facilities On a stand alone basis without the pigging facilities we can justify the project James Original Message From Geaccone Tracy Sent Monday October PM To Centilli James Subject FW LaPlata DRA Application Cost Estimate Have you had a chance to run this If not when do you think you will Thanks Original Message From Sturn John Sent Monday October PM To Geaccone Tracy Subject RE LaPlata DRA Application Cost Estimate Tracy Have you made any progress on the economic analysis Thanks John Forwarded by John SturnETSEnron on PM From John Sturn on AM To Tracy nronXgate cc Rich JollyET NRON Earl nronXgate Ben nronXgate Gary nronXgate Kim nronXgate Subject RE LaPlata DRA Application Cost Estimate OLE Object StdOleLink Tracy MMBTUD of incremental capacity from LaPlata to Gallup This is the working assumption from our initial conference call Like the cost figures below it may vary with further evaluation but I suggest it be used for this initial analysis Thanks John From Tracy nronXgate on PM To John SturnET NRON cc Rich JollyET NRON Earl nronXgate Ben nronXgate Gary nronXgate Kim nronXgate Subject RE LaPlata DRA Application Cost Estimate How much additional capacityvolumes will I get Original Message From Sturn John Sent Friday September PM To Geaccone Tracy Cc Jolly Rich Chanley Earl Asante Ben Choquette Gary Kouri Kim Subject LaPlata DRA Application Cost Estimate Tracy Below are the rough cost estimates to apply drag reducing agent to the LaPlata to Bloomfield line Facility modifications Cleaning application Reapplication every months The facility modifications include a launcher at LaPlata receiver at Bloomfield and a filter separator at the El Paso Blanco delivery The cleaning application and reapplications costs include cleaning pig runs with methanol and surfactant as well costs for the actual DRA application For analyzing sensitivities all costs are The reapplication time period is also uncertain You may want to look at the economics of reapply as often as every three months and as infrequently as every months Please let me know of anything else you need Thanks John
Southern Trails Project Cc Do you have some time next week to bring you up to date on the project Let Tracy and I know your availability for next week Thanks James

Reapplication every months The facility modifications include a launcher at LaPlata receiver at Bloomfield and a filter separator at the El Paso Blanco delivery The cleaning application and Background on Ken Chowyour request James Forwarded by James CentilliETSEnron on PM Kenneth Chow PM To James CentilliET NRON cc Ronald MatthewsET NRON Subject Background on Ken Chow James The following contains the background information you requested I have al so attached my resume for your review Please let me know if you have any further questions Thanks for all your help Ken Degree Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering Education Facility Name McGill University Montreal Canada Career Path As an engineer in Enrons Analyst Program I have not been on the rotat ion track of a typical analyst My technical background and experience led me to nontraditional rotations in Facility Planning and System Optimization These rotations gave me the unique opportunity to work as an engineer in a commercial environment With the Houston Pipe Line Facility Planning Team I provided technical support to marketing and producer services In my curre nt rotation with the ETS System Optimization Team I apply my engineering knowledge to maximize pipeline value My objective is to gain more experience in the financial aspects of ETS I am interested in learning how to perform project evaluations and financial analysis so my intent is to have a greater emphasis on finance in my final rotation My strength lies in technical work but I envision my knowledge o f assets and operations to be an infusion of different intellectual capital t o the ETS finance group I always had a desire to learn about finance having taken accounting courses in high school and through my college classes in economics and operations research At Enron I continued to pursue this interest by attending development courses in corporate finance and risk management I also registered to take the GMAT so that I can keep my MBA option open I want to make an informed decision on business school when I graduate from t he Analyst Program By developing my financial skills I intend to become a more valuable Enro n employee I want to bring some financial focus back to the engineering grou p so we can manage our assets more efficiently Combining what I learned in previous rotations with what I could learn from the finance group will give me a new and fresh perspective That is why I approached Ron Matthews and James Centilli about a hybrid PlanningFinance position In our changing business environment I feel this will be mutually beneficial to all Ronald Matthews AM To Kenneth ChowET nron cc Subject Ken Chow Forwarded by Ronald MatthewsETSEnron on AM James Centilli AM To Ronald MatthewsET NRON cc Subject Ken Chow Rod wants to know some background on Ken Chow Degree Education Facility Name Career Path Thanks James

TW Expansion Projectattached model has the RAROC and COS model in the various spreadsheet The rates I gave on the matrix and the COS rate track for the MMBTUd expansion at the M unleveraged We would experience negative depreciation for the first five years of the project Under the debt equity scenario we would have a rate about and that tracks with the DCF model and we would have escalating depreciation rates over the term of the project

James S Hathorn Resume Cc attached resume Thanks James Forwarded by James CentilliETSEnron on PM From John Shafer PM To James CentilliET NRON cc Louis SoldanoET NRON Subject Help James I enjoyed being with you during our most recent trip and meeting with SoCAl Gas in Los Angeles After getting to know you at least briefly I was wondering if you could give me a little help My soninlaw is a young CPA who now works for Reliant Energy in Shreveport We have been circulating his resume a little around Enron and have gotten little interest Do you know anyone in the finanace end of the business accounting etc in which you could pass his resume along I would really appreciate any help you could give me Thanks John Shafer

Re Statement of Work Template Etc Cc be a good process to communicate the information needed for non budgeted projects What discretionary level to move budgeted dollars did Stan give to the VPs Anything above that level should be submitted for review by this process Rod Hayslett AM To Denis NRON David NRON James CentilliET NRON Dave WaymireET NRON Cheryl NRON cc Jerry NRON James NRON Subject Statement of Work Template Etc What do you think about using something like this proposal for most of our major projects over MM could even go lower This has been proposed by Morris specifically for EOTT projects but there is no reason to exclude others Forwarded by Rod HayslettFGTEnron on AM AM Morris Brassfield Morris Brassfield Morris Brassfield AM AM To Rod NRON cc Subject Statement of Work Template Etc What do you think about using this proposed document for approving any EOTT project that is outside the approved Project budget plan Heres my attempt at the template

Holiday Schedule Cc schedule is for Economic Analysis Dave will cover for me when I am on vacation and vica versus When we are both off we will provide phone numbers in the event we need to come in and work I will be in town over the holidays and I can be reached at James

Goals and Objectives Cc and cost saving ideas to generate additional earnings Coordinate administrative and analytical support for the monetization of a significant level of nonstrategic assets Include in the analysis all appropriate contacts within ETS Arthur Andersen experts and corporate accounting contacts Perform economic analysis of projects and asset sales to provide the management team a complete risk assess evaluation on all projects Provide financial support to Marketing in developing financing structures and evaluation process for structured products Update evaluation as factors change and provide information to appropriate contacts within ETS Other Ideas for goals and objectives Developing Economic Analysis utilizing the Revenue Management information Northerns South End Assets Depreciation Study Enhancing Value of Assets monetizing nonstrategic assets TWs Expansion leveraging cost with Enron Compression Services or other off balance sheet structures Northerns North End Power Generation structured deals support

RE Sun Devil backhaul rate to PhoenixAre we using the Case for volumes or something else Original Message From Hyatt Kevin Sent Wednesday February AM To Centilli James Cc Gadd Eric Subject Sun Devil backhaul rate to Phoenix James can you please run cases to calculate a backhaul rate to Phoenix using Sun Devil case Using the Capex of which includes the Red Hawk lateral what does the rate need to be using load factors for years with the terminal value and our hurdle return rate of Assume fuel at for the entire term source of gas would likely be Cal border area storage facilities case same as above but load factors as follows year year year year We are trying to respond to Panda Energy by Friday thanks kh

TW Expansion Cc A questions was raised in last Fridays meeting regarding the impact of a fuel tracker to the TW Expansion economics Based on a fuel tracker starting in the six year of the project the DCF changes from to over the year project life If you have any other question please let me know
TW Expansion Rates Sensitivity Cc Please see attached for rates based on different rate and resubscription percentage of and James

TW Mainline Expansion Cc The attached files are the analysis of Option and Option for the TW Expansion The analysis for Option was not adjusted for the lost revenue but the attached file reflects the range of revenue that will be impacted by the overhauls of the existing units The following assumption were used for each option If you need to print the analysis for or expansion you only need to print the first pages of the workbook Option Install RB at Station thru Volume MMcfday Transport Rate Used Capital Investments MM Capital Estimate Operating Cost of Existing Units HP BtuHPHR Operating Cost of New Units HP BtuHPHR Design Rated HP HP Site Rated HP Required HP Incremental HP Retainage Load Factor Mean Average Standard Deviation Existing Units will be abandon in place Ad Valorem Tax will be the same for either option Option Install Nuovo Pignones at Station thru Volume MMcfday Transport Rate Used Capital Investments MM Capital Estimate Operating Cost of Existing Units HP BtuHPHR Operating Cost of New Units HP BtuHPHR Design Rated HP HP Site Rated HP Required HP Retainage Load Factor Mean Average Standard Deviation Ad Valorem Tax will be the same for either option Overhaul Revenue Lost Range for Days of downtime MM to MM Note Not included in IRR Option IRR and Option IRR Both project can be structured to fit current rate structure or a negotiated rate structure by adjusting OM assumptions and debtequity ratios I will be out of the office Wednesday afternoon thru Friday If you have any questions please call me at Ext or at home

RE Location Number Cc The location number for the TW Gomez lateral are listed in the attached file James Original Message From Carriere Frank Sent Wednesday February PM To Centilli James Cc Hyatt Kevin Hubbard Mary Subject FW Location Number Can you help us with determining a location code for the Gomez Lateral on TWs books Would these facilities be included in one of the locations listed below By description and quantity we are unable to confirm Kevin is attempting to meet with cusotmers tomorrow Thanks for you help Original Message From Hubbard Mary Sent Wednesday February AM To Carriere Frank Subject RE Location Number See attached requested data File TW xls Original Message From Hyatt Kevin Sent Tuesday February AM To Carriere Frank Hubbard Mary Subject RE Location Number Importance High I found these numbers in a file Loc Code Im not sure what assets they are in reference to kh Original Message From Carriere Frank Sent Tuesday February AM To Hyatt Kevin Subject FW Location Number FYI As I indicated in my phone message we are not finding these assets using the description provided Judy Beck is or was the facilitiy person for ETS She is now Dynegy therefore we may get a referral instead of an answer Original Message From Hubbard Mary Sent Friday February PM To Carriere Frank Subject FW Location Number FYI Original Message From Hubbard Mary Sent Friday February PM To Subject Location Number Judy I need to provide a NBV for a Gomez Laterial miles of pipe to Kevin Hyatt Frank says it should be in company TW I ran the following locations numbers but found nothing in co Can you help Thanks Mary I

Horsepower Requirements Cc Ben or Ron Please provide the horsepower requirement for the Sun Devil Project at the various load factor on the attached spreadsheet hplf We need to be able to see what impact Sun Devil has after Red Rock in the event the California load decline below MMbtuday or Arizonia load are not at the MMBtuday levels Need information as soon as you can provide it Thanks James
Red Rock NPV Cc The FERC interest rate is I updated the NPVs based on that rate I added a comparison between the discount rate per term for the rates as bid Thanks James

Red Rock Expansion Cc The following rates would be required to meet the cash flow target discount at to cover the capital cost Yr MMBtud Yr MMBtud Yr MMBtud Yr MMBtud The following rates would be required on the remaining capacity to achieve a IRR for the project Yr assumes no fuel tracker Yr assumes a fuel tracker starting in year I will be on vacation tommorrow but if you want some additional cases ran on Monday please send me an email and I will start working on them first thing Monday morning Thanks James

Red Rock Expansion Cc The attached analysis was preformed on a year project life The current contracts bids provide a cash flow discount at of MM The cash flow requirement to cover the capital cost is MM The remaining years on the MMBtuday at an average rate of bid from PPL was not factor in to the analysis because it is difficult to calculate the associated OM and other cost that would be incurred to provide the service in years through The NPV of the contract discount at is MM To cover the remaining capital cost and not factoring in the value of the remaining value of the PPL contract and additional MMBtud at a rate of would be required to cover the remaining MM If you want to print the analysis you will only need to print the first eleven pages of the workbook for TWEXPYrxls You can execute the print function from the page that open in the DATAGRAPHxls file If you have any questions please let me know Thanks James
Red Rock Updates Cc See attached for the Western Contract impact based on yrs at and Yrs
Corrected File Red Rock NPV Cc Please discard earlier file had an error on BPs contracts Thanks James

Electric Compressor Agreement with ENA and ECS Cc A meeting has been scheduled for PM in EB for today December th to discuss contracts and administrative solution to assure electric bills are paid and compressor continue to operate Charlie we will call you in your office If others in Omaha want to participate please gather in Charlies office Thanks James

RE Southern Trails Data Request ListDo not have any additional items James Original Message From McConnell Mark Sent Monday October PM To Huber Lee Moore Jerry Thomas Brassfield Morris Hawkins Don Dowd Stephen Abdmoulaie Mansoor Curry Jim Schick Warren Lokey Teb Lichtenwalter Blair Chandler Bob Centilli James Ratner Michael Subject Southern Trails Data Request List Please look at the attached If there are some things missing please let me know If some things on the list are not applicable please note that too Just send your deletionsadditions to me via email If you can get this to me by the end of the day Wednesday that would allow us to proceed with Questar all the sooner Thanks Mark File Southern Trails Data Request Listdoc Mark McConnell Transwestern Pipeline Company office cell fax

Brassfield Morris Dushinske John Fancler Dan Miller Mary Kay Marion Pierre Centilli James Porter J Gregory Zabawa Mike Fossum Drew Subject RE Hubbard ENA Charlie I think your summary is very good I would like to add that although Midland cannot discontinue service to ENA for failure to pay the and invoices Midland can shut off service if ENA fails to pay any future invoices So its imperative that someone from Northern very closely monitor the situation with ENA and Midland to ensure that ENA makes the necessary payments In addition the bankruptcy court may require ENA to provide Midland with adequate assurance of future payments If required this will most likely take the form of a cash deposit or a letter of credit Again if ENA fails to provide this adequate assurance Midland may discontinue service Original Message From Graham Charlie Sent Tuesday December PM To Rice Randy Gilbert Tom Cc Rapp Bill Brassfield Morris Dushinske John Fancler Dan Miller Mary Kay Marion Pierre Centilli James Porter J Gregory Zabawa Mike Subject Hubbard ENA After the meeting yesterday and speaking to Bill Rapp and several others today I believe I can summarize the HubbardENA circumstances as they exist right now The Hubbard Compression Services Agreement is with Enron North America ENA and ENA has filed for bankruptcy The outstanding Oct and Nov Midland Power Coop electric bills to ENA have not been paid and probably wont be until the bankruptcy proceeding unfolds if at all Under bankruptcy law a utility cannot discontinue service to a debtor for not paying invoices outstanding at the time bankruptcy is filed and Bill Rapp has asked ENAs bankruptcy attorneys to provide the attached notice to Midlands Power Cooperative Under supervision of the bankruptcy court future invoices received after bankruptcy was filed Dec will be paid by ENA if they have the cash ENAs nomination of dthd of Monthly Fuel Gas Payable from NNG has been confirmed and is flowing This is their source of cash Gas Accounting will continue to pay the Monthly Demand Charge and the Monthly Peak Compression Service Charges ranges from to The next payment is not due until the end of December ENAs OM payment to NNG for motor operation will be billed on the th of each month One months payment should have been outstanding when bankruptcy was filed and therefore not paid however it was actually paid to NNG on Dec th ENAs next Peak Associated Payment is not due to NNG until July There is no certainty when dealing with a bankrupt entity however this is where we are today The theme I keep hearing is business as usual Tom Someone from Operations should probably followup with Midland Power I suggest a boat load of empathy regarding their in limbo after they get the ENA letter Charlie Graham Phone Fax OMA File qDOC
